text:
It seems images do not render correctly given some properly formatted SVG files.
Only a portion of the image would render, but not the whole image.
You can find the SVG file at:

http://www.bungisoft.com/downloads/expansion_unit.svg

PNG File resides here:

http://www.bungisoft.com/downloads/expansion_unit.png

PNG File was generated using the following rasterizer command:

java -jar batik-rasterizer.jar c:/tmp/expansion_unit.svg

This bug seems to be consistant with all image types
creator: ilya@bungisoft.com

text:
The problem is that the SVG document contains no viewBox or
width and height attribute on the outermost SVG element.
Without these the rasterizer doesn't know what part of the
infinate canvas it should render so it defaults to 400x400.

You can have the SVG generator specify the width and height
attributes by calling setSVGCanvasSize on the SVGGraphics2D
before streaming the content out.
creator: deweese@apache.org
